Comment: President Donald Trump is disrupting US trade policy as never before. His tariff gyrations are roiling financial markets, raising the prospect of recession, and alarming allies. Amid this heightened policy uncertainty, a new episode of *Economics, Applied* considers the economic and geopolitical consequences of the Trump administration’s recent trade policy moves with two outstanding experts. Host [Steven J. Davis](https://www.hoover.org/profiles/steven-j-davis) speaks with Chad Bown, senior fellow at the Peterson Institute for International Economics, and Douglas Irwin, professor of economics at Dartmouth College, about recent policy shifts and what it would take to restore confidence in the United States as a reliable trade partner.
